name: DCH Blood Spot Outcome SCD SnCT
description: A code from the SNOMED Clinical Terminology UK coding system that describes the outcome of the blood spot screening for sickle cell disease.
copyright: This value set includes content from SNOMED CT, which is copyright Â© 2002+ International Health Terminology Standards Development Organisation (IHTSDO), and distributed by agreement between IHTSDO and HL7. Implementer use of SNOMED CT is not covered by this agreement.

concept.display: Newborn blood spot specimen received
Sickle cell screening declined
Sickle cell screening declined, no history of being screened
Sickle cell screening declined, screened in UK (as reported by parents) with no evidence of result
Sickle cell screening declined, screened outside UK with evidence of result
Sickle cell screening declined, screened outside UK with no evidence of result
Newborn blood spot screening programme, sickle cell repeat screening with further sample required
Sickle cell screening, too young for reliable screening (finding)
Sickle cell screening, sample taken too soon after blood transfusion (less than 72 hours) (finding)
Sickle cell screening, insufficient sample
Sickle cell screening, unsuitable sample (blood quality): incorrect blood application
Sickle cell screening, unsuitable sample (blood quality): compressed/damaged
Sickle cell screening, unsuitable sample: day 0 and day 5 on same card
Sickle cell screening, unsuitable sample: NHS number missing/not accurately
Sickle cell screening, unsuitable sample: date of sample missing/not accurately recorded
Sickle cell screening, unsuitable sample: date of birth not accurately matched (finding)
Sickle cell screening, unsuitable sample: expired card used
Sickle cell screening, unsuitable sample: more than 14 days in transit, too old for analysis
Sickle cell screening, unsuitable sample: damaged in transit
Sickle cell screening, too premature for testing
Sickle cell trait not suspected
Carrier of sickle cell gene mutation
Sickle cell trait not suspected, no other haemoglobin or thalassaemia excluded
Result consistent with haemoglobin C carrier
Result consistent with haemoglobin D carrier
Result consistent with haemoglobin E carrier
Result consistent with haemoglobin O-Arab carrier
Newborn blood spot screening programme, sickle cell not suspected and other disorders follow up required (finding)
Suspected sickle cell trait
Newborn blood spot screening programme, sickle cell not screened for or screening incomplete
Sickle cell not screened for or screening incomplete, over 1 year old, too old for screening
Sickle cell not screened for or screening incomplete, moved out of area
Sickle cell not screened for or screening incomplete, not contactable, reasonable efforts made
Sickle cell not screened for or screening incomplete, baby died
Sickle cell not screened for or screening incomplete, not required, previous valid result
Haemoglobin S not suspected (by deoxyribonucleic acid), no other haemoglobin or thalassaemia excluded
